reviews.review_msg: I took this course online distance as part of my PDP. Worst way to end a great program. The readings were boring and useless. Clarkson's commentary was the same. The course is boring and has a lame structure. If I could I would travel back in time and take ANY other course. Even EDUC Fingernails on chalkboard would have been more useful.
Jerry is the greatest prof!

Jerry will make you think and will challenge any thinking you may already have about Education (something not many profs do). Very fair marker (lets you re-write everything once, except for the final) and gives you feedback on your work. He tends to be long winded in answering questions in class and lectures can be a bit boring. Good overall.
great class. great professor. He's super knowledgable, compassionate, caring, thoughtful. It's not an easy class, but it will get you thinking.
Great prof!  Great class!  Very understanding and helpful.  Highly recommended!
Distance ed class.  Jerry is great at responding to questions and provoking online discussion.  Overall, a good class.

The lectures are pretty long and boring. I baked a pie during our Zoom call and managed to get a good grade. There were a lot of papers and assignments with unclear grading criteria and no feedback was given in the semester.

Maureen is clearly passionate about environmental education. On the downside she did not provide any feedback or grades until they were uploaded to gosfu. I found this to be unfair and unprofessional. I still have no idea how I did on each individual assignment. Maureen needs to get organized and provide real feedback.

she rambles too much and it's easy to snooze in her lecture (which can be very long btw). She's a super super easy marker. attendence is mandatory but it feels like a waste of time to even go (but i recommend just sitting there and doing other coursework). Particpation matters in class just cuz it'll be quiet otherwise and not fun
best prof ever

Natalia is a wonderful professor who cares deeply about not only the material she teaches but also the students themselves. I learned a ton in her class through her practical applications of the educational curriculums we were taught, with the roleplays and group work we did in seminars. The readings provided excellent discussions in class as well.
Really enjoyed the class. She knows her stuff!

I'm not an Education major, but I learned so much from Natalia.  She opened my eyes to different types of culture of curriculums.  Don't be afraid that she does not have lecture notes for class, she doesn't need them! Its refreshing to have a prof like her.  It's a really fun class and you'll learn things beyond the classroom.

She is an amazing teacher; my major is not education, but she really opened up my eyes to curriculum and implementing change. One of the best profs in my University career, seriously, don't take this class with anyone else.
You don't need to do very much work outside of class to do well, it's mostly just in-class participation. So impressive though, completely made me rethink my views on education - for the better!
One of the best course I've taken at SFU. Love the way the class is structured where it is not time-consuming and a great deal of concepts is learned! Prof is funny, kind and caring!

This is the best class I've taken in my 4 years of undergraduate studies. I've learned the most from this professor than any others and she not only taught from her book, but she taught us from her life. Her life experience is one of the most interesting and educational to learn from. She is also a great mentor, always wishing the best for students

THE BEST class I have ever taken at SFU. This is the only time I can say that my $600 was well spent at SFU. She is the most caring, generous, and knowledgeable professor I have ever had the privilege to learn from. The text was a bore, but she brought it to life in her comedy filled lectures. The hardest part of the course: registering for it!
She's very easy-marking.  Attend all her classes and read the textbook, you'll be no problem.
Awesome prof, I would recommend taking her class just because she is great!
She's Great!!!
great prof I ever had! enjoy her class so much and had a good result at the end of the term:)

She is the most amazing professor I've ever had in post-secondary. She has very strong opinion about few things but she likes the challenge so you can make a nice discussion session. Highly recommend to take class with her.
His previous year's ratings are very deceiving. I'm astonished how he treats students. Ruined my semester.

His instructions regarding assignments are unclear. Unwilling to compromise on workload. Students can't ask for clarification with risking mark deducted from their final grade for emailing him. You'd think an educ prof would encourage comm between students and teachers, but I guess nature works in mysterious ways.

For some reason SFU hired a professor who makes typos and grammar mistakes in his assignment description for a entirely reading and writing class. You learn absolutely NOTHING from his class and teaching. I have no words. What a scam of a class and professor.
there are points for coming to the class. prof is very helpful, but have to study for every class or you will pile up lot of readings to do if u start at the end of the semester.
The most fair deal in SFU. Prof want to earn payment from SFU and $40 from each student , student just sit for 4hours for at least B grade.

Slava was the worst professor I have ever had. He forces students to buy his classical music CD's for the assignment. You also watch three movies that are not related to curriculum or curriculum development! I have not learned anything about curriculum or curriculum development.. take if you want an easy grade but you will be frustrated!!
He is the best ever!! so kind!! take this class!!

The best prof I have ever had. He is caring, friendly, and very good at teaching. Course material is very interesting. Presentations and assignments are fun to do. Even though it is a 4 credit course the workload is not too heavy. Highly recommended Slava!

The distance education section is not taught nor marked by Senyshyn. Your grade is completely dependent on your TA. As this is a 400 level course, assignments are marked very academically. There are 2 online discussions to be completed every week, 6 major assignments, many readings, and a take-home final exam. Be prepared to work very hard!
the very best ever. be prepared to do work.

He's not kidding when he demands concise critical thinking. If you don't consider yourself an 8/10+ when it comes to written English, avoid his class! You MUST be able to articulate, and he's looking to fail a couple people per course. Anything he tells you on the first day is to be taken LITERALLY; decide then whether to drop or tough it out.
Nice
Stuart is so great!  Fun assignments, interesting readings, relatable experience, and fun to watch-he's like a character from a Christopher Guest movie; very quirky!
Good prof! The readings were at times very boring and dry but Gillian did her best to make them interesting

I took 471 online and this course has to be the most disorganized, messy course I have ever seen in my 5 years at SFU. As an education major, I LOVE Education and have never been so angry and upset with a course in my life. Grading is so illogical and zero feedback is given - it's all on the TA who is horrible. And a 50% FINAL? Avoid at ALL costs.

Dr. Han's classes are for those who possess self discipline. She is an amazing scholar who began her journey in rural China, a life testament to where dedication to academic study can take you. She will respect those who act respectfully to her and fellow classmates. Her respect is worth earning. Her class is an opportunity to challenge yourself.

Take classes with Dr. Han if you are prepared to take the subject seriously. Dr. Han comes from rural China and has had an amazing academic journey to be the accomplished scholar she is today. Dr. Han's class is for those with self discipline. Earn her respect, it is worth it. She respects those who respect her and their fellow classmates.
No Comments
Had so much trouble staying awake. A lot of pointless activities. Yes, very much a joke. (Also v.difficult to talk to him face to face, you'll know why).

Don is a great proff teaching a great class. Workshop style of his class is extremely refreshing in this old, stale university we call sfu. Great back burner class, but if you put some effort in, you will get a lot out of it. Would recomend to anyone wanting to become a teacher.
Teaches a pretty easy course.  Barely any readings, assignments were easy and he doesn't really lecture that much, which is good.  Go DOn!
His lecture material and activites were very good, but i would have gotten much more out of the class if he hadn't talked as much. at times he seemed to go off on pointless tangents.
No Comments

Without a doubt, best prof at SFU. I've never connected so much with a class or the people in it. You need to participate in/show up to class so don't be afraid to give your opinion (no wrong answers). Should do the weekly journals since there is a big portfolio presentation at end, but nothing to worry about. TAKE THIS CLASS, you won't regret it.

FANTASTIC Prof. She was new when I did EDUC 252 with her but she was very accommodating. As long as you did your weekly journal writings about topic discussed in the module/class you would do well. write around 500 words about reflecting about EDUC, yourself, how it connects to future/past experiences in HS/ELM.PARTICIPATION MATTERS, don't be shy

Gives work back from weeks 1 and 2 during week 8 and expects us to "do better" even though it's nearing the end of the course. Unclear instructions on how she wants her assignments formatted. When you ask her what you can do to improve she isn't clear on what she wants to see.
good teacher
Seems disorganized
Easy as hell. Do all the work and get A. Assignments were pretty much completion mark do it and get full marks.
